title: Interesting Font for Resume
content: I'm updating my resume and was wondering if anyone could recommend a sans serif font that is interesting but still resume-appropriate. Thanks!
author: jasculley

comments.content:
I really enjoyed using Today Sans from Elsner and Flake.

If you have a lot of content you might use something like Amplitude.

Mikey

I'm using Whitney (Hoefler & Frere-Jones) on my resume. I see it as being an attractive typeface thats easy to read, but still have some character to it. It's also a very complete set if you want to spend the money. :)

[http://www.typography.com/fonts/font\_overview.php?productLineID=100026](http://web.archive.org/web/20141202112515/http:/www.typography.com/fonts/font_overview.php?productLineID=100026 "http://www.typography.com/fonts/font\_overview.php?productLineID=100026")

Yes, Hoefler and Frere make some fabulous stuff.

I’m crazy I would try using their Didot for my resume.

Mikey :-)
